Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: pale purple satin-bound book on Entomological Studies
A pale purple satin-bound book on Entomological Studies.
A pale purple satin-bound book on Entomological Studies.

A pale purple satin-bound book. On the upper portion of the cover is the title 'A Brief Explanation of Entomological Studies' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'Written by Arethusa Alberdine'.
pale purple satin-bound book cover

A pale purple satin-bound book. On the upper portion of the cover is the title 'A Brief Explanation of Entomological Studies' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'Written by Arethusa Alberdine'.

A pale purple satin-bound book. On the upper portion of the cover is the title 'A Brief Explanation of Entomological Studies' and printed smaller beneath it are the words 'Written by Arethusa Alberdine'.
a list of insects

There are many kinds of insects. After much study I have compiled a list of known species into, hopefully, easy to reference categories. They are as follows.
There are:
bees
beetles
flies
moths
and butterflies
ants
grasshoppers
crickets
I will go into detailed explanation of each category in the next pages.

There are:
bees
beetles
flies
moths
and butterflies
ants
grasshoppers
crickets
I will go into detailed explanation of each category in the next pages.
a description of bees and wasps

Bees and wasps are flying insects, and are known for production of honey and beeswax. There are many known kinds of bees, (such as brumblebees) though as with most species of spider and insect, the number of how many kinds there are, is probably much higher than those known.
Their antennae are made of up to 13 segments. Bees have two pairs of wings, the hind being smaller, and in a few one sex or caste has short wings that make it hard or impossible to fly, but none are wingless.
The best known bee is the species Calabrian honey brumblebee which, as the name suggests, produces honey, as do many other bees.
Human management of bees is called Beekeeping.
Most bees are fuzzy. Most eat from a variety of plants, while some others have been observed to actually eat carrion.
Bees nests are called hives, and can have anywhere from 50 to 200 bees living in one, at the peak of population.
Although the bee sting can be painful, which may stereotype them as pests, bees are commonly help in high regard. This is because of their usefulness as producers of honey, and their social nature, and their reputation for diligence.

Although the bee sting can be painful, which may stereotype them as pests, bees are commonly help in high regard. This is because of their usefulness as producers of honey, and their social nature, and their reputation for diligence.
a description of beetles

Beetles are the group of insects with the largest number of known kinds. They can be found in most any habitat, though rarely in sea, and polar regions. They often feed on plants and fungi, and eat other insects. Most beetles are known to farmers as pests, as eat crops, but ladybugs are helpful as they eat the pests that damage crops.
The anatomy of a beetle is quite uniform, although specific appendages and known organs (from dissection) may vary. Not much is known about the functions of found organs, in any species of spider or insect. The beetle is divided into three sections, which are called, the head, thorax, and abdomen.
When viewed from above, most beetles appear to have three clear sections, but this is deceptive: on the beetle's upper surface, the middle "section" is a hard plate, which is only the front part of the thorax; the back part of the thorax is concealed by the beetle's wings.
They have a hard outer shell, The beetle's outer shell is made up of numerous plates, separated by thin sutures. This design creates the armoured defences known of the beetle while maintaining flexibility. This hard shell must be raised in order to move the hind flight wings. A beetle's flight wings are crossed with veins and are folded after landing, often along these veins, and are stored underneath, though some beetles have lost the ability to fly, they are commonly called ground beetles.
Beetles are laid as eggs, and grow into what we call larvae, until the final stage of development. They have an extremely variable lifespan from what I can tell.

A beetle's flight wings are crossed with veins and are folded after landing, often along these veins, and are stored underneath, though some beetles have lost the ability to fly, they are commonly called ground beetles.
Beetles are laid as eggs, and grow into what we call larvae, until the final stage of development. They have an extremely variable lifespan from what I can tell.
a description of flies

Flies are defined by having a single pair of wings. It is a large group containing mosquitoes, gnats, very small flies called midges, and others.
Flies are very well adapted for aerial movement, and typically have short, streamlined bodies. Mating is a short process, and eggs generally hatch immediately after being laid. Flies are observed to have short lifespans.
I have heard stories of maggots being used in medicine to clean wounds, but I do not know of it's merit.

Flies are very well adapted for aerial movement, and typically have short, streamlined bodies. Mating is a short process, and eggs generally hatch immediately after being laid. Flies are observed to have short lifespans.
I have heard stories of maggots being used in medicine to clean wounds, but I do not know of it's merit.
a description of moths and butterflies

Most moths are awake at night, while butterflies during the day.
Many moth larvae ruin clothing, as are defined as pests. While butterflies are quite beautiful.
Both begin as caterpillars, devouring much food in a short time, and pose threat to farmers. They can cause extensive damage especially to fruit farms. Several moth larvae eat fabric such as clothes and blankets made from natural fibers such as wool or silk. They are less likely to eat mixed materials. There are some reports that they can be repelled by the scent of wood from juniper and cedar, by lavender, or by other natural oils.
Some moths are farmed, such as the silkworm, for silk with which it build it's cocoon. Other moths also produce silk.
Moths are commonly seen flying to flame. It is unknown why they do this.
Butterflies have large, brightly coloured wings, and conspicuous, fluttering flight. Some butterfly larvae are a threat to farms, also.
Butterflies have varying life-spans.
They have quite a life-cycle which is commonly observed. They are known as caterpillars, and often on the underside of a leaf, build cocoons and turn into butterflies. It's unknown how the transformation happens inside the cocoon.
Butterflies have four wings, and six legs. They feed on flowers.
Notable species are swallowtails, monarchs, and skippers.

a description of ants

Ants are easily identified by their thin waist, and elbowed antennae. Ants form large colonies, and appear to work as a unified entity. Ants are seen living just about everywhere.
Their success is often attributed to their social organization and their ability to modify habitats, tap resources, and defend themselves.
Many cultures use ants in cuisine, medication, and rituals.
Ants are found in all habitats on Calabria, except very freezing and inhospitable places. They can exploit a wide range of food sources, as plant eaters, predators, and scavengers.
Colours vary from red, black, green, and many have a metallic luster.
They have very distinct antennae. They have three segments to their body, and six legs.
Ants work in distinct social classes. Soldiers, workers, queens, drones.
Ants attack and defend themselves by biting, and stinging. They have jaws which snap shut very fast.
Complex nests are build by ants. They can be found in the ground, under stones or logs, inside logs, hollow stems, and even acorns. Honey ants store food to prevent colony famine, and are very delectable.

a description of grasshoppers and crickets

Such as locusts.
Grasshoppers have antennae shorter than their body length. They can make noises by rubbing their legs or wings together, or by snapping their wings in flight. Their hind legs are long and strong, fitted for leaping. Generally they are winged, but not fit for flight. They have six stages of development, getting larger every time until fully grown. Grasshoppers and crickets eat primarily grass, and many other plants.
Locusts are a common known pest to farmers, they can migrate in swarms in a very coordinated way, causing massive damage to crops.
Many varieties are green, and so difficult to spot.
Crickets can chirp. Crickets are sometimes kept as pets, and considered good luck in some cultures. Cricket fighting is also a pastime.

the spine of the book
The spine of the book is made from a pale purple satin binding.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[M] \$delay(2, TRUE, "030f"); EmitTo( \$actor, "The pamphlet does not react to you in any way except to look more daunting and self-assured in its knowledge.");
